other_tests.findings: Cultures of specimens from the synovium and capsule were positive for Brucella melitensis.
other_tests.changes_over_time: In 1993, the rose bengal test and the agglutinin titer were negative and treatment was discontinued. Five years later, the patient was asymptomatic and had no signs of prosthetic loosening on radiographic evaluation.

other_tests.findings: Cultures of specimens from the capsule, the distal femoral interface, the joint fluid, and the acetabular interface were positive for Brucella melitensis.
other_tests.changes_over_time: At the time of the latest follow-up at three years, the patient was asymptomatic and had good joint function.

other_tests.findings: The rose bengal test was positive and serological tests for Brucella melitensis were positive (titer, 1:80).
other_tests.changes_over_time: Four weeks later, she was readmitted because of spontaneous serous drainage of the surgical wound and the presence of a knee joint effusion. Cultures of wound exudates and joint fluid were negative.
